title: President of Israel
summary: The president of the State of Israel (Hebrew: נְשִׂיא מְדִינַת יִשְׂרָאֵל‎, romanized: Nesi Medinat Yisra'el, or Hebrew: נְשִׂיא הַמְדִינָה‎, romanized: Nesi HaMedina, lit. 'President of the State') is the head of state of Israel. The position is largely a ceremonial role,[2] with executive power vested in the cabinet led by the prime minister. The incumbent president is Isaac Herzog, who took office on 7 July 2021. Presidents are elected by the Knesset for a single seven-year term.
